required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Human ESC-derived Neural Precursor Cells in the Treatment of Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Open-Label Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Striatum Transplantation of Human Embryonic Stem Cells-derived Neural Precursor Cells in Patients With Parkinson's Disease

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of intracerebral transplantation of human embryonic stem cells-derived neural precursor cells in patients with Parkinson's Disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a Phase I/II, open-label, non randomized clinical trial. The study will enroll 50 patients for cell injection, administering a single dose of neural precursor cells by stereotaxic intra-striatal injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), severe TEAEs as assessed by head MRI and blood examination
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with adverse events such as the evidence of graft failure or rejection

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) score from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The total Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) score is derived from Part I (Mentation, Behavior and Mood), Part II (Activities of Daily Living) and Part III (Motor Examination). Part I assesses 4 functions; Part II assesses 13 activities of daily living; Part III assesses 14 motor symptoms. Each item is rated on a scale from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe). The minimum total score possible is 0 and the maximum total score possible is 176. Each subject was independently rated by two observers at each study visit and a mean score was calculated for analysis.

DATscan is an imaging technology that uses small amounts of a radioactive drug to help determine how much dopamine is available in a person's brain.Its principle is based on using of radiopharmaceutical, which bind to dopamine transporters (DAT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hoehn and Yahr Stage from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The Hoehn and Yahr scale is a commonly used system for describing how the symptoms of Parkinson's disease progress mainly by observing balance and walk.

arm_group.description: The patients will receive Levodopa combined with a regular neural precursor cell (NPC) transplantation
The patients will receive Levodopa combined with a HLA-matched neural precursor cell (NPC) transplantation
The patients will receive Levodopa combined with a HLA-non-matched neural precursor cell (NPC) transplantation

intervention.description: The cells are stereotactically implanted in the striatum.
Levodopa is used depending on the patient's condition

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of zoology, Chinese Academy of Sciences

facility.name: The first affiliated hospital of Zhengzhou university

responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy director of Institute of zoology, Chinese academy of sciences, and vice president of medical school， University of Chinese academy of sciences
